column4: Hi guys! I wonder what i wright to extrakt a .zip file? In the Terminal i mean.
is it ok?
Oh okey
Well. I have to Unzinp a file in to a directory. The zip file is not in the same directory. How do i do then??
looking at 'man unzip', I find that you can use unzip FILE -d EXDIR, where EXDIR is the directory you want to extract to
unzip FILE
okey :D  can i privv u? i have one more question. Its hard to explain. Its about the zip file
sorry I have them disabled, ask here there are plenty who can help
first you wouldn't have to be where the zip file is if you gave the full path to it, secondly you'll need sudo to unzip into /usr/local, and this is UNLIKELY to be what you want to do
what is it exactly?
its java. For firefox
ok, typically you would want to just use what is in the repositories... I'm not that up on Java, maybe someone else here can help you with why you need to install it manually
im just folowing a guide for it atm. But just in the ending it just sed Unzip ---> here. And i didnt know how to unzip :d
no problem
im doint it in a windowd mode with the "unzipper" But i do not have promission to change anything in the map.  How do i login as root in "window" mode?
that's a whole 'nother story... I thought you wanted to do it on the command line? that's the best way honestly
otherwise you need to launch the GUI apps with gksudo, but be very very careful when having GUI apps running as root
gksudo file--roller
gksudo file-roller
the zip file?
type that in terminal or Alt+F2 box, then open your zip with open file...
